title: Besapara Hill
text:
Besapara Hill (Halm Besapara \'h&lm be-sa-'pa-ra\) is a hill of 250m projecting from <a href="Sopot%20Ice%20Piedmont">Sopot Ice Piedmont</a> in <a href="Delchev%20Ridge">Delchev Ridge</a>, <a href="Tangra%20Mountains">Tangra Mountains</a> on <a href="Livingston%20Island">Livingston Island</a>, <a href="South%20Shetland%20Islands">South Shetland Islands</a> in <a href="Antarctica">Antarctica</a>. The <a href="hill">hill</a> was mapped in the Bulgarian topographic survey <a href="Tangra%202004/05">Tangra 2004/05</a>, and is named after the ancient <a href="Thracians">Thracian</a> town of Besapara, ancestor of the present <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgarian</a> city of <a href="Pazardzhik">Pazardzhik</a>.
Location.
The hill is located at which is 500m north of <a href="Kaloyan%20Nunatak">Kaloyan Nunatak</a>, 2 km east of <a href="Vaptsarov%20Peak">Vaptsarov Peak</a> and 1.5 km west of <a href="Mesta%20Peak">Mesta Peak</a>.
